column4: is there a list of programs maintained by canonical, like libreoffice?

libreoffice is maintained by The Document Foundation
to the ubuntu OS, yes they package it and ensure it gels with the rest. but the app itself is maintained upstream
yes if the video chip gets 3D drivers out of the box
the GPU is the chip on the card. The actual card itself is irrelevant, you just need the chip
you could disable to repo then install packages, you can use /var/log/dpkg.log to see what was recently installed
says last updates were in april but i just installed ubuntu tday?
so the last lines at the bottom say april?
the ones installed most recently will be the ones you installed from backports, you can reinstall those packages
well the thing is I don't want the backports there ;) but you think it eats up any memory having them installed anyway (if they were - I can't really tell if they were but I assume that they were)
doesn't eat up memory at al..
what is the output of:  lsb_release -sc
how do I properly purge this ppa? sudo add-apt-repository ppa:webupd8team/rhythmbox
you will need to remove rhythmnbox with the PPA added, then remove the ppa then install rhythmnbox
so remove it from by clicking remove in the USC then purge the PPA?
sounds good, or you can use apt-get , either is fine
